column5: Where could I buy a flasher battery close to Ottawa?  Thanks!

If I remember correctly that is a 12 volt 7ahr sealed lead acid battery.  The best price I've found for that one is at a place called TorBram.  The ones I know about are in Pickering and Whitby and they're $22.  Or you could go to the Source and pay $59 for the  same thing. Good Luck. T

Any electrical supply store will carry those batteries. I'm not talking your local home hardware, you need an electrical supplier. I get mine at a place called OSSO electric. They are in Lindsay and Oshawa. I think the last one I got was $24. Sinker

Sometimes a hard find. Our local electric supplier.. Ideal.. doesn't carry them in stock.. but the local alarm place does for $$'s.  I ordered mine online -  Two x 8ah-12v for $37 and $13 shipping from Saskatchewan... so $25 each without leaving my chair and a trip to the post office to pick up.
Yah they do... but they are generally time x'd items out of some foreclosure etc. I've made the mistake of buying PA batteries and had them DOA !

Most places use them for back up emergency lighting. If there is a place that deals with that kind of stuff around ottawa, check there as well.  There is an OSSO electric in Kingston.....but still a little far I guess?  Sinker
Should've told me last Sunday Nodie, i went to LB's on Monday and picked one up.  They have lots.
If you ask they would probably ship to your door and their in Ottawa too.  http://www.batteriesexpert.com
